title: ValueError: Unsupported format type 'ast'

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Bug that shouldn't change language semantics when fixed.

labels.name: Easy Pickings
labels.description: Used to denote issues that should be easy to implement

body:

### What's your issue about?

This contract:
```
v0: uint256
@public
def f0(av0: uint256) -> uint256:
    lv0: uint256 = self.v0
    return self.v0
```

Causes the compiler, in python, to claim that "ast" is an unsupported format:

```
>>> vyper.cli.vyper_compile.compile_files(["v2.vy"], ["bytecode", "abi", "ast", "bytecode_runtime"])
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/adg326/vyper-venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/vyper/cli/vyper_compile.py", line 241, in compile_files
    interface_codes=get_interface_codes(root_path, contract_sources)
  File "/Users/adg326/vyper-venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/vyper/compiler.py", line 312, in compile_codes
    raise ValueError(f'Unsupported format type {repr(output_format)}')
ValueError: Unsupported format type 'ast'
```

Seems to run ok from command line, 

Another TSTL-produced contract (https://github.com/agroce/tstl/tree/master/examples/vyper)

### How can it be fixed?

Fill this in if you know how to fix it.
